issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
I have found some problems like http://blog.sarathonline.com/2010/08/maven-only-type-parameters-of-x-cannot.html.It compiled successful in eclipse ,but compile  in maven failure.
I have solved this problem with  plexus-compiler-eclipse, code as follows:
In pom.xml
<plugin>  
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>  
                <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>  
                <version>2.5.1</version>  
                <configuration>  
                    <source>1.6</source>  
                    <target>1.6</target>  
                    <compilerId>eclipse</compilerId>  
                </configuration>  
                <dependencies>  
                    <dependency>  
                        <groupId>org.codehaus.plexus</groupId>  
                        <artifactId>plexus-compiler-eclipse</artifactId>  
                        <version>1.8.4</version>  
                        <exclusions>  
                            <exclusion>  
                                <groupId>org.eclipse.jdt</groupId>  
                                <artifactId>core</artifactId>  
                            </exclusion>  
                        </exclusions>  
                    </dependency>  
                    <dependency>  
                        <groupId>org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler</groupId>  
                        <artifactId>ecj</artifactId>  
                        <version>3.7.1</version>  
                    </dependency>  
                </dependencies>  
            </plugin>  
In  plexus-compiler-eclipse.jar EclipseJavaCompiler.java ,I add some compile parameters :
settings.put("org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.problem.unusedTypeArgumentsForMethodInvocation", "warning");  
settings.put("org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.problem.uncheckedTypeOperation", "warning");  
settings.put("org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.problem.finalParameterBound", "warning");  
settings.put("org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.problem.rawTypeReference", "warning");

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

comments.body: Can you make a testcase for this ?
